meanings.definition: Capable of being pacified or satisfied.
meanings.sent1: The crying baby was appeasable once given her favorite toy.
meanings.sent2: The hungry cat was appeasable after being fed a bowl of tuna.
meanings.sent3: The grumpy old man became appeasable when offered a warm cup of tea.
meanings.sent4: The stormy sea seemed appeasable as the sun began to set.
meanings.sent5: The angry customer's tone became appeasable once his issue was resolved.

meanings.definition: Willing to make concessions to someone in order to maintain peace.
meanings.sent1: She was appeasable and agreed to compromise on the project deadline.
meanings.sent2: The negotiator was appeasable and willing to listen to the other party's demands.
meanings.sent3: The siblings were surprisingly appeasable during the car ride, avoiding any arguments.
meanings.sent4: The diplomat's appeasable nature helped in resolving the conflict peacefully.
meanings.sent5: His appeasable attitude diffused the tension in the room during the heated discussion.
